intro: Galium vaillantii, commonly known as the slender bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and usually oval to lance-shaped with a slightly hairy surface. Galium vaillantii thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
